required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Smoking Cessation in Subjects With Mild-to-moderate Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD).
clinical_study.official_title: A 12-Week, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Multicenter Trial With 40-Week Follow-Up Evaluating The Safety And Efficacy Of Varenicline Tartrate For Smoking Cessation In Patients With Mild-To-Moderate Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to be conducted in subjects with mild-to-moderate COPD who are cigarette smokers with the intent of demonstrating differences in smoking cessation between varenicline and placebo.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Four Week Continuous Quit Rate (CQR)
primary_outcome.description: Number of subjects who reported no smoking and no use of other nicotine-containing products since the last study visit (on the Nicotine Use Inventory [NUI]) and with end-expiratory exhaled carbon monoxide (CO) measurement less than or equal to 10 parts per million (ppm) for weeks 9 through 12 (inclusive).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Continuous Abstinence (CA)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects who reported no smoking and no use of other nicotine-containing products (treatment phase = through week 12) or tobacco products (non-treatment phase = after treatment phase; follow up through week 52) at each contact (on the NUI) and with end-expiratory exhaled CO measurement less than or equal to 10 ppm from week 9 through week 24 and week 52. CO confirmed in-clinic visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Long Term Quit Rate (LTQR)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects who were responders for the primary endpoint (4-week CQR for Weeks 9 through 12) and who had no more than 6 cumulative days of smoking from Week 12 through the given visit (Week 24 and Week 52). CO confirmed in-clinic visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With 7-Day Point Prevalence of Abstinence
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects at given visit (Week 12, Week 24, Week 52) or telephone contact, reported no smoking and no use of other nicotine-containing products (treatment phase) or tobacco products (non-treatment phase) in the last 7 days and with end-expiratory exhaled CO measurement less than or equal to 10 ppm. CO confirmed in-clinic visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With 4-Week Point Prevalence of Abstinence
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects at Week 52 visit reporting no smoking and no use of other tobacco products in the last 4 weeks and with end-expiratory exhaled CO measurement less than or equal to 10 ppm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Pre-bronchodilator and Post-bronchodilator Forced Expiratory Volume in First Second (FEV1)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in mean FEV1 (forced expiratory volume in the first second of forced exhalation) measured in millimeters (ml) as mean at observation minus baseline value. Directly after pre-bronchodilator measurement, subject inhaled albuterol or salbutamol delivered by metered-dose inhaler (MDI); post-bronchodilator lung function repeated 30 to 45 minutes following administration of albuterol or salbutamol.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Clinical COPD Questionnaire (CCQ)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline: mean at observation minus baseline value. Subject-administered 10-item instrument to systematically assess COPD symptoms (items 1, 2, 5, and 6), functional states (items 7, 8, 9, and 10) and mental states (items 3 and 4); For each domain score = sum of items divided by the number of items; total score = sum of scores divided by 10; range from 0 (very good health) to 6 (extremely poor health). Assessed at each visit based on subject's experience during the week prior to visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Cigarettes Smoked Daily During First 3 Weeks of the 12-Week Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Number of cigarettes smoked daily collected during the first 3 weeks of study after randomization using patient smoking diaries.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Inflammatory Biomarkers: C-Reactive Protein (CRP) and Fibrinogen Antigen
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in CRP and Fibrinogen antigen (blood markers of inflammation) calculated as mean at observation minus baseline value; measured as milligrams per deciliter (mg/dl).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Body Weight
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline calculated as mean at observation minus baseline value; body weight measured in kilograms (kg).

intervention.description: 1mg (placebo) by mouth twice daily for 12 weeks (first week is up titration schedule---0.5mg once daily for 3 days, 0.5mg twice daily for 4 days)
1 mg by mouth twice daily for 12 weeks (first week is up titration schedule---0.5mg once daily for 3 days, 0.5mg twice daily for 4 days)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects will be current cigarette smokers who have smoked an average of at least 10 cigarettes per day during the past year and during the month prior to the screening visit.
- mild to moderate COPD confirmed by spirometry
- Subjects must have a clinical diagnosis of COPD.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who have made a serious attempt to quit smoking in the past 3 months.
- Subjects who have been previously randomized in a study that has included varenicline.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects were current cigarette smokers 35 years of age or older with mild to moderate Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) as defined by Global Initiative for Chronic Obstructive Lung Diseases (GOLD) criteria.

group.title: Varenicline
group.description: Varenicline 0.5 milligrams (mg) once daily (QD) for 3 days; followed by 0.5 mg twice daily (BID) for 4 days; then 1 mg BID for 11 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo 0.5 milligrams (mg) once daily (QD) for 3 days; followed by 0.5 mg twice daily (BID) for 4 days; then 1 mg BID for 11 weeks.

participants_list.participants: After treatment completion at Wk 12, subjects may continue in nontreatment follow-up phase
After treatment completion at Wk 12, subjects may continue in nontreatment follow-up phase
Discontinued Tx=12 Adverse Event (AE); 10 Lost to follow up; 13 subject withdrawal; 6 other, unknown
Discontinued Tx=14 AE;3 Lack of efficacy;10 Lost to follow up;25 subject withdrawal;6 other, unknown
Completed study through nontreatment follow-up phase Week 13 to Week 52
Completed study through nontreatment follow-up phase Week 13 to Week 52

analysis.groups_desc: Primary endpoint was based on a CO confirmed 4-week CQR (weeks 4 through 12 inclusive). Intent was to evaluate the alternative hypothesis that varenicline is superior to placebo for smoking cessation after 12 weeks of treatment in subjects with mild to moderate COPD.
analysis.p_value_desc: p-value obtained from a logistic regression model including the main effects of treatment and pooled center
analysis.estimate_desc: odds ratio obtained from a logistic regression model including the main effects of treatment and pooled center

CO confirmed in-clinic visit.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Pre-bronchodilator and Post-bronchodilator Forced Expiratory Volume in First Second (FEV1)
outcome.description: Change from baseline in mean FEV1 (forced expiratory volume in the first second of forced exhalation) measured in millimeters (ml) as mean at observation minus baseline value. Directly after pre-bronchodilator measurement, subject inhaled albuterol or salbutamol delivered by metered-dose inhaler (MDI); post-bronchodilator lung function repeated 30 to 45 minutes following administration of albuterol or salbutamol.
outcome.population: All subjects population; (n) = subjects with analyzable data at observation for varenicline and placebo, respectively. Missing data imputed by carrying the last observation forward (LOCF), including baseline values.

outcome.description: Change from baseline: mean at observation minus baseline value. Subject-administered 10-item instrument to systematically assess COPD symptoms (items 1, 2, 5, and 6), functional states (items 7, 8, 9, and 10) and mental states (items 3 and 4); For each domain score = sum of items divided by the number of items; total score = sum of scores divided by 10; range from 0 (very good health) to 6 (extremely poor health). Assessed at each visit based on subject's experience during the week prior to visit.
outcome.population: All subjects; (n) = subjects with analyzable data at observation for varenicline and placebo, respectively.

outcome.title: Number of Cigarettes Smoked Daily During First 3 Weeks of the 12-Week Treatment Period
outcome.description: Number of cigarettes smoked daily collected during the first 3 weeks of study after randomization using patient smoking diaries.
outcome.population: All subjects population; (n) = number of subjects who smoked at least 1 cigarette at the given day for varenicline and placebo, respectively.
